item.title: My Ongoing Journey with Emacs
item.description: init I’m rapidly becoming known as “that Emacs guy” in my office. I’m very vocal about my love for this ~35 year old piece of software, and (unsuccessfully) evangelize it amongst my peers. Whenever one of my coworkers shows the smallest amount of interest in it, such as “Hey that presentation you gave with the code blocks, what was that in?”, it’s off to the races. I’m prone to inundate them with additional reading materials and youtube videos about emacs and org-mode and why they should also consider using it to organize their life.

item.title: A Citizen's Guide to Cybersecurity
item.description: TL;DR - You should use a password manager and two factor authentication. What’s the haps, homeslice? Nowadays, an individual’s online presence is dictated by many, many accounts. Each account has some primary identifier - typically a username, or more commonly an email address. Additionally, each account has its own password. We’ve been taught that these passwords must be secure - combinations of letters, number and symbols that would be difficult for someone to guess.

item.description: Nothing to see here right now sadly…working on it!
